title: How to Recycle Televisions

steps.headline: Drop off your television at an electronic retail store.
steps.description: Many retail chain stores, such as Staples, Office Max, and Best Buy collect old TVs to recycle. These companies, and similar ones may have a drop-off location where they will collect the TV in-store. Other retail chains may require you to ship your TV to another location for recycling. Some stores will even come to your house to pick up your TV! However, they will most likely charge a fee for this service. Call the retail location in advance to make sure they will take your TV before you drive there. Some stores may only accept certain types or brands.

steps.headline: Take your television to a local recycling center.
steps.description: If you can’t find a retail store that will take your television, another option is to take your old TV to a recycling center. Depending on where you live, you can find one close to you. Look online for a site that will locate recycling centers in your area. All you need to do is select your city and state, and they will provide a list of recycling locations most convenient to you. Make sure you read the descriptions of all locations and call ahead to make sure they will take your television.

steps.headline: Find a company that will pick up your television for recycling.
steps.description: There are many companies nationwide that will gladly do all the work for you if you choose to recycle. Simply conduct a quick Google search to find a junk removal company what will come to your residence and schedule a pickup time. All you need to do next is sit back and wait for them to arrive. Most companies will take care of any heavy lifting, removal, and cleanup. Just remember that there will be a fee for their service! The cost of removal will depend on a few factors; such as size, location, and the number of items.

steps.headline: Restore factory settings to erase your personal data.
steps.description: If you have a smart TV, there is a chance that it collects some of your personal and financial data. You’ll want to erase all of this information before donating or selling. If you still have the user manual that came with your television, read it to find steps to complete a factory reset. If not, you may be able to find instructions for your specific TV online. This step is important to protect your privacy and prevent anyone from accessing your personal information.

steps.headline: Drop your television off at a nonprofit donation organization.
steps.description: There are many donation centers throughout the country that will happily accept your old television if it is still in good working condition. Some popular nonprofit organizations include the Salvation Army and Goodwill, but there are many others. You can find a charity online with a simple Google search. Enter your city and state to find a donation location near you. Some charities will pick up your television for free, so you don’t even have to leave the house. If you donate a TV or other items to a nonprofit organization, make sure you get a receipt. Your donation may be tax deductible.

steps.headline: Advertise your TV for free on classified sites.
steps.description: If you’re feeling particularly generous, consider donating your television to someone online. Use a website like Craigslist or Facebook to post an ad stating that you’re giving your television away to anyone that is willing to pick it up. You can choose to have them pick it up at your residence, or you can meet up with them to hand it off. Craigslist has a section on its site titled “free” where you can post your television.

steps.headline: Take several clear photographs of your television if you’re selling it online.
steps.description: It is recommended to post at least 4 pictures of an item when selling it online, and the quality of the photos is important. So take several pictures from all angles and choose the best ones to post. If you’re selling any accessories that came with the TV, such as the remote and the manual, include them in your pictures so your buyer knows exactly what they’re getting. Try to take your pictures in natural lighting. Artificial lights may alter the color of the TV. Make sure to clean up your TV before taking photos. Dust it off and wipe the screen to get rid of any dust or debris that might show up on a photo.

steps.headline: Consider a selling price for your television.
steps.description: Determining a price for your TV can be tricky. If you ask for too much money, it won’t sell. But if you price it too low, you won’t get all the money it’s worth. To select the best price, consider the condition your TV is in. If your TV is fairly new and there are no defects or scratches, you may be able to sell it pretty close to the original price. However, if it’s an older TV, you may need to lower the price significantly. One idea is to look at online listings to see how much other people are selling similar TVs. This will give you a good idea of what people will be willing to pay for it.

steps.headline: Choose an online retailer to sell your television.
steps.description: There are many options out there to sell your used TV on an online store. Some popular sites include eBay and Craigslist. All you need to do is take pictures of your TV, post the pictures on the chosen online store, and then provide a detailed description. Then sellers will either bid on your item or buy it immediately at the price point you selected. Some sites, like Craigslist, allow you to sell your TV locally so you don’t have to worry about shipping costs. This may be a good option if you don’t want to deal with shipping charges and are comfortable with meeting up with buyers in person. Sites like eBay allow you to ship your TV anywhere across the country. This helps your listing to reach more potential buyers. However, you are responsible for handling shipping as well as services charges through the website. Include detailed descriptions along with clear pictures so the buyer knows exactly what they’re getting. Let them know how old your television is, what condition it’s in, and any extra technical specs.

steps.headline: Trade in your old TV for cash.
steps.description: There are many companies that will take your old electronics and give you cash or gift cards. Some popular companies that do this are Amazon, Apple, and BestBuy. Search their websites for information on which items you can sell and how much you can get for them. Their prices offered may be a little bit lower than what you might expect, but keep in mind that you won't have to worry about shipping costs or service charges. Do your research to compare sites in order to get the best deal when trading in your television.
